Courses Views#

This section provides documentation for views related to courses within the eLearning app.

class eLearning.views.courses.CoursesView(**kwargs)#

Bases: ListView

View for displaying a list of courses.

This view retrieves and displays a list of courses with the status “official”.

Variables:

  • model (Type[django.db.models.Model]) – The model used for retrieving the list of courses.

  • template_name (str) – The name of the template used for rendering the list of courses.

  • context_object_name (str) – The name of the context variable containing the list of courses in the template.

context_object_name = 'courses'#
get_queryset()#

Retrieves the queryset of courses with the status “official”.

This method filters the queryset of courses to include only those with the status “official”.

Parameters:

self (CoursesView) – The view instance.

Returns:

The queryset of courses with the status “official”.

Return type:

QuerySet[Course]

model#

alias of Course

template_name = 'public/view_courses.html'#
class eLearning.views.courses.OfficialCourseView(**kwargs)#

Bases: UserPassesTestMixin, TemplateView

A view to display the course materials for students and teacher.

dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)#

Dispatch method with custom login decorator.

Parameters:

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the request.

  • args (tuple) – Additional positional arguments.

  • kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

HttpResponse object representing the response.

Return type:

django.http.HttpResponse

get_context_data(**kwargs)#

Method to get context data for rendering the template.

Fetches course information, materials, and form for editing the course.

Parameters:

kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

A dictionary containing context data.

Return type:

dict

post(request, *args, **kwargs)#

Method to handle POST requests for updating course details.

Validates the form and updates the course details.

Parameters:

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the request.

  • args (tuple) – Additional positional arguments.

  • kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect object for redirection.

Return type:

django.http.HttpResponseRedirect

template_name = 'user/course.html'#
test_func()#

Method to check if the user is authorized to access the course.

The user must be either the teacher of the course or enrolled in it.

class eLearning.views.courses.WeekView(**kwargs)#

Bases: View

View for managing course weeks.

This view handles the creation and deletion of weeks for a course.

delete(request, *args, **kwargs)#

Handles DELETE requests to delete a week from a course.

This method deletes the last week of the specified course by decrementing the duration_weeks attribute of the course.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • args (tuple) – Additional positional arguments.

  • kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

An HTTP response indicating the success or failure of the deletion.

Return type:

HttpResponse

patch(request, *args, **kwargs)#

Handles PATCH requests to create a new week for a course.

This method creates a new week for the specified course by incrementing the duration_weeks attribute of the course. It then renders the HTML markup for the new week.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • args (tuple) – Additional positional arguments.

  • kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

An HTTP response containing the HTML markup for the new week.

Return type:

HttpResponse

eLearning.views.courses.course_details(request, course_id)#

View for displaying details of a specific course.

This view retrieves details of a specific course identified by the provided course ID. It checks if the current user is authenticated and if they are enrolled in the course.

Parameters:

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course for which details are to be displayed.

Returns:

The rendered course details page.

Return type:

django.http.HttpResponse

eLearning.views.courses.create_course(request)#

Handles the creation of a new course.

If the request method is POST, attempts to create a new course using the data submitted in the form. If successful, redirects to the draft page for the newly created course. If a course with the same name already exists for the current user, displays an error message and redirects to the dashboard.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect object for redirection.

Return type:

django.http.HttpResponseRedirect

eLearning.views.courses.delete_course_material(request, course_material_id)#

Deletes a course material.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_material_id (int) – The ID of the course material to be deleted.

Returns:

An HTTP response indicating successful deletion.

Return type:

HttpResponse

eLearning.views.courses.enroll(request, course_id)#

Enroll a user in a course.

This view handles the enrollment process for a user in a course. It checks if the user is already enrolled, and if not, creates a new enrollment for the user in the specified course. It also sends an enrollment email to the user upon successful enrollment.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course to enroll in.

Returns:

An HTTP response with html button or error message.

Return type:

JsonResponse or HttpResponse

eLearning.views.courses.enrolmentEmail(user, course)#

Sends an enrollment confirmation email to the user.

This function sends an email to the provided user to confirm their successful enrollment in the specified course. The email contains details about the course such as its name, start date, end date, duration, teacher’s name and email.

Parameters:

  • user (django.contrib.auth.models.User) – The user who has been enrolled in the course.

  • course (YourCourseModel) – The course in which the user has been enrolled.

eLearning.views.courses.get_week_materials(request, course_id, week_number)#

Retrieves materials for a specific week of a course.

If the request method is GET, retrieves materials and assignments for the specified week of the course. Renders the materials template with the retrieved data and upload forms.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course.

  • week_number (int) – The week number for which materials are requested.

Returns:

An HTTP response with the rendered materials template and data.

Return type:

HttpResponse

eLearning.views.courses.materialsUpdateEmail(students, course, week, num_of_materials)#

Sends an email update about new course materials to the specified students.

This function sends personalized email updates to each student in the provided list, informing them about the addition of new course materials for a specific week in the course. Each email contains information about the course, the week, the number of new materials added, and instructions on accessing the materials.

Parameters:

  • students (list of django.contrib.auth.models.User) – The list of students to whom the email updates will be sent.

  • course (YourCourseModel) – The course for which the materials update is being sent.

  • week (int) – The week number for which the materials update is being sent.

  • num_of_materials (int) – The number of new materials added for the specified week.

eLearning.views.courses.publish_course(request, course_id)#

Publishes a course.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course to be published.

Returns:

An HTTP redirect response to the dashboard.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

eLearning.views.courses.student_ban_status_update(request, course_id, student_id)#

Updates the ban status of a student enrolled in a course.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course.

  • student_id (int) – The ID of the student.

Returns:

An HTTP response containing HTML content.

Return type:

HttpResponse

eLearning.views.courses.upload_assignment_material(request, course_id, week_number)#

View function to handle the upload of assignment materials for a specific course and week.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the request.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course.

  • week_number (int) – The week number.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect object redirecting to the ‘get_week_materials’ view.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

eLearning.views.courses.upload_material(request, course_id, week_number)#

Handles the upload of materials for a specific course and week.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course for which materials are being uploaded.

  • week_number (int) – The week number for which materials are being uploaded.

Returns:

An HTTP redirect response to the ‘get_week_materials’ view for the specified course and week.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

eLearning.views.courses.upload_student_submission(request, assignment_id)#

Handles the submission of an assignment by a student.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • assignment_id (int) – The ID of the assignment.

Returns:

An HTTP redirect response.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect
